body:
I was trying to build packages on TOSS 2 after having spack's compilers configured for TOSS 3 and I got the following error:

./bin/spack install graphlib@2.0.0
==> Error: There are no valid versions for graphlib that match '2.0.0'

I fixed this for myself by concatenating a TOSS 2 and TOSS 3 compiler.yaml, but perhaps there should be a more intuitive error message or some mechanism that looks for and auto populates a valid architecture in the compilers.yaml if none exists.
title: invalid compilers.yaml leads to unintuitive "no valid versions" error
